intro: Ardisia coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico, Central America, and the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green, leathery leaves that are often covered in small, raised bumps. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers followed by bright red, berry-like fruits. Ardisia coriacea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting berries.
